reference.shortdesc: A subject relationship-table header is the header in a subject relationship table. It contains column definitions for the subject relationship table.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Each cell in the header row identifies a subject topic that defines a role. When specializing the subjectRelTable element, you can accomplish the same purpose by specializing the cells within the rows to enforce the roles.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The subjectRelHeader element is specialized from relrow. It is defined in the subject scheme module.

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: Why wasn't this element specialized from relheader?
I think Erik Hennum wanted a different content model than relheader allowed:

ul.li: relheader contains one or more relcolspec; relcolspec contains an optional title, optional topicmeta. and zero or more topicref.
subjectRelHeader has the same content model as subjectRole (subject reltable row): one or more subjectRel (subject reltable cell).

draft-comment.p: I'm honestly not sure what the use cases for this were.
